definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out

sentences.english: His vision blurred and a wave of dizziness washed over him.
sentences.chinese: 他的視線模糊了，一陣頭暈目眩衝擊着他。

sentences.english: Mount Everest reaches the dizzy height of 8848 meters.
sentences.chinese: 珠穆朗瑪峯8848米的高度讓人覺得頭暈目眩。

sentences.english: Garret dropped into the water and had a blank moment of dizziness.
sentences.chinese: 蓋瑞特掉進了水裏，一時頭暈目眩。

sentences.english: His dizzy revery lasted all night long.
sentences.chinese: 他經過了一整夜的頭暈目眩的苦思。

sentences.english: The Regent broke the connection and Edwards sat there, his head swimming.
sentences.chinese: 瑞金特切斷了連線，愛德華茲坐在那裏，頭暈目眩。

sentences.english: I felt dizzy during the planes ascent.
sentences.chinese: 當飛機上升，我覺得頭暈目眩。

sentences.english: My heart leaps and I feel dizzy whenever I see you.
sentences.chinese: 每次見到妳，我就小鹿亂撞外加頭暈目眩。

sentences.english: A feeling of dazed dizzy not-rightness, like the sensation you feel before acute nausea?
sentences.chinese: 那種在你開始嘔吐之前頭暈目眩的不適感？

sentences.english: I was dizzy and woozy , and my heart was racing.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得頭暈目眩，然後我的心跳很快。

sentences.english: I couldn't stand on my left leg and my heAD was woozy from hitting the ground.
sentences.chinese: 我的左腿不能站立，由於與地面碰撞，頭暈目眩。

sentences.english: Even though he felt dizzy, he did rescue the drowning child.
sentences.chinese: 雖然他覺得頭暈目眩，他還是救出了落水兒童。

sentences.english: I drove at speeds that dizzied me.
sentences.chinese: 我高速駕車致使我頭暈目眩。

sentences.english: At Present, what kind of vertigo occupies our breathes?
sentences.chinese: 現在，什麼樣的頭暈目眩使我們無法呼吸？

sentences.english: I am dizzy by the time I hang up with Mrs.
sentences.chinese: 和斯梅德利夫人通完電話我都已經頭暈目眩了。

sentences.english: It has graphics that dazzle your visual sense and sounds that tantalize your ears.
sentences.chinese: 它給你頭暈目眩的視覺和聽覺感受。

definition: an excess of heat caused by a deficiency in Yin energy (idiom)
to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
deficiency of yin 陰|阴[yin1] in TCM
